name: yots/u/ba
description:
The repository for the old build of /u/'s board describes itself as "the 4chan of VA-11 Hall-A" - yots/u/ba is an attempt at taking that a little too literally.
Several elements either inspired by or taken straight from 4chan's Yotsuba B theme. Includes, but is not limited to:
• Actual greentexts
• Blue backgrounds + borders on posts
• Link and link hover colors taken straight from the yotsublue CSS
• etc.

* Note: if you're a desktop userscript user, I'd like you to know that I have not yet tested several of the userscript options. As such, I cannot guarantee compatability. User discretion is advised.

user.about: Bored person with a penchant for cross-browser compatible HTML/CSS and low-contrast themes.

additional_info: Jul 31: Additional Authenticity DLC (hotfix) • Essentially, every capcode now has the Mod color and badge. I would've preferred having respective colors and badges, but awoo's capcode reference is no more complex than just a div with the redtext class. While this does make it a hell of a lot easier to fiddle with, since every other redtext instance is under a span rather than a div - therefore meaning that a div.redtext edit will only ever refer to capcodes - it also makes it too incomplex to have multiple changes. If only W3C's :includes() addition was a thing... • EDIT: Remember when I said meaning that a div.redtext edit will only ever refer to capcodes? Apparantly they don't! They also appear under the lockedcontainer IDs for those mean ol' texts that say "this thread is closed." Whoops. A quick content: ""; should've fixed that. • Oh, and 'Start a new thread' links now imitate Yotsuba's as well. Aug 11: Sticky Shortfix • Turns out that danger/u/ actually has eight sticky classes rather than seven. Why? Beats me. In any case, added .sticky-8 and its respective :hover to the other stickies. • Nine, actually. What the actual fuck?
